result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

9/26/22 FPT Notice
Final pre-trial on September 26, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on August 8, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Final pre-trial on July 14, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
SWITS

11:09 AM Attorney David R. Knaapen for State of Wisconsin appeared in court. Defendant Joel A Toruno Ruiz appeared by video, in custody, Attorney Gavin Grubofski for Joel A Toruno Ruiz appeared in court. SWITS interpreter, Laura Salcido, appears by phone and is sworn.
Aaron Wargowsky is sworn as a witness and questioned by Attorney Knaapen. He is an officer with the Marshfield Police Department. On 3/3/22, he was dispatched to a residence in the City of Marshfield regarding a physical disturbance. When he arrived, it was resolved and the person had left. He made contact with ABR. She indicated that she had a physical altercation with defendant. He spoke to defendant on the phone and asked him to come to the police department to talk to him, which he did. The witness identifies the defendant in the courtroom. ABR indicated that defendant choked her and she was not able to breathe. She did not give him permission. She indicated that she and defendant were in a relationship and living together.
Attorney Grubofski cross-examines witness. 
Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the defendant committed it. Not guilty plea.
The bond poster is requesting that the bond money she posted be returned to her. State does not object.
Court will grant request to return bond to poster.
Final pre-trial scheduled for June 3, 2022 at 09:00 am.

02:31 PM Defendant Joel A Toruno Ruiz in court with attorney Gavin Grubofski.  Defendant Joel A Toruno Ruiz in custody.  David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Joel A Toruno Ruiz appeared by video means with Attorney. SWITS interpretor Mariana Kralewski appears in court by telephone. Victim ABR appears in court.
Court is re-doing this hearing due to the victim wanting to be present for it. Court goes over the initial appearance that was held and gives the details to the victim. Victim makes a statement to the court wanting to dismiss the charges. Court informs the victim that it isn't possible because it is up to the DA's office. Court explains what bond is to the victim. 
Victim requests bond modification to lower bond. Court grants and lowers it to $3500.00
Victim witness coordinator makes a statement regarding the victim wanting at least phone contact.
No contact w/victim or their residence - ABR

01:16 PM Defendant Joel A Toruno Ruiz in court with attorney Gavin Grubofski.  Defendant Joel A Toruno Ruiz in custody.  David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Joel A Toruno Ruiz appeared by video means with Attorney. Interpretor Mariana Kralewski from SWITS appears in court by telephone. 
Court finds probable cause to continue this matter. Bond is set. This matter will be bound over for preliminary hearing and arraignment.
